segment.source: Every Microsoft Surface Hub is automatically set up with BitLocker drive encryption software.
segment.target: Every Microsoft Surface Hub is automatically set up with BitLocker drive encryption software.

segment.source: Microsoft strongly recommends that you make sure you back up your BitLocker recovery keys.
segment.target: Microsoft strongly recommends that you make sure you back up your BitLocker recovery keys.

segment.source: Every Microsoft Surface Hub is automatically set up with BitLocker drive encryption software.
segment.target: Every Microsoft Surface Hub is automatically set up with BitLocker drive encryption software.

segment.source: Microsoft strongly recommends that you make sure you back up your BitLocker recovery keys.
segment.target: Microsoft strongly recommends that you make sure you back up your BitLocker recovery keys.

segment.source: There are several ways to manage your BitLocker key on the Surface Hub.
segment.target: There are several ways to manage your BitLocker key on the Surface Hub.

segment.source: If you’ve joined the Surface Hub to a domain, the device will back up the key on the domain and store it under the computer object.
segment.target: If you’ve joined the Surface Hub to a domain, the device will back up the key on the domain and store it under the computer object.

segment.source: If you can’t find the BitLocker key after joining the device to a domain, it’s likely that your Active Directory schema doesn’t support BitLocker key backup.
segment.target: If you can’t find the BitLocker key after joining the device to a domain, it’s likely that your Active Directory schema doesn’t support BitLocker key backup.

segment.source: If you don’t want to change the schema, you can save the BitLocker key by going to Settings and following the procedure for using a local admin account, which is detailed later in this list.
segment.target: If you don’t want to change the schema, you can save the BitLocker key by going to Settings and following the procedure for using a local admin account, which is detailed later in this list.

segment.source: If you’ve joined the Surface Hub to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), the BitLocker key will be stored under the account that was used to join the device.
segment.target: If you’ve joined the Surface Hub to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), the BitLocker key will be stored under the account that was used to join the device.

segment.source: If you’re using a local admin account to manage the device, you can save the BitLocker key by going to Settings and navigating to SystemMicrosoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: If you’re using a local admin account to manage the device, you can save the BitLocker key by going to Settings and navigating to SystemMicrosoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: Insert a USB drive and select the option to save the BitLocker key.
segment.target: Insert a USB drive and select the option to save the BitLocker key.

segment.source: The key will be saved to a text file on the USB drive.
segment.target: The key will be saved to a text file on the USB drive.
